# 1. Analyze various coding annotations

<br>

> Annotations include 

+ Ribosnitch (allele-specific)
+ RBP binding sites
+ conservation (GERP)
+ Polyphen-damaging (Mis3)
+ Loss-of-function and Gain-of-function
+ CADD 

## 1.1 For WGS data

Use manuscript data/MSSNG/Simons_519, scaling factors are computed using WGS data, based on coding regions and regions 10kb within TSSs.


### 1.1.1 manuscript meta-analysis data
+ coding RR estimation.[link](analysis/180214_results_summary_manuscript_data_RR_estimation_with_mutrate_adjusted_for_div_coding_features.html)(Mutation rate adjusted using all mutations of manuscript windows including exons, promoters and promoter-proximal non-coding regions )


### 1.1.2 MSSNG data
+ coding RR estimation (scaling file doesn't account for div score).[link](analysis/180216_RR_estimate_DATA_Yuen_2017_ANNO_RR_estimate.html)(Mutation rate adjusted using all mutations of manuscript windows including exons, promoters and promoter-proximal non-coding regions )

+ coding RR estimation (scaling file accounting for div score).[link](analysis/180216_with_div_adjusted_RR_estimate_DATA_Yuen_2017_ANNO_RR_estimate.html)
* [Adjusting mutation rate accounting for div score](analysis/180215_recalibrate_mutation_rate_with_div_score_for_MSSNG_and_Simons_519.html) (Mutation rate adjusted using all mutations of manuscript windows including exons, promoters and promoter-proximal non-coding regions )

+ About 75% of the Yuen et al. data used in the TADA-A manuscript are also found in the denovo-db Yuen data. 

Execution code to do data partition and reading-in is `code/pipeline00_generate_R_code_for_estimating_RR_using_partitioned_data`

+ coding RR estimation accouting for div score, using the 7-mer ERV mutation rate mode, using all mutations of coding, promoters, promoter-proximal noncoding regions and UTRs to to adjust mutation rates. Each study has its own separate mutation rate adjusting model [link](analysis/180412_with_div_mutrate_calibration_adjusted_RR_estimate_ERV_mutrate_additional_covariates_joint_model_noXY_DATA_Yuen_2017_cases_ANNO_RR_estimate.html).

+  coding RR estimation accouting for div score, using the 7-mer ERV mutation rate mode, using all mutations of coding, promoters, promoter-proximal noncoding regions and UTRs to to adjust mutation rates. Each study has its own separate mutation rate adjusting model, after the 1st round of mutation rate adjustment, also adjust for the effects of the functional annotations on mutation rate, using informative priors from WES data. [link](analysis/180502_with_div_mutrate_calibration_adjusted_RR_estimate_ERV_mutrate_additional_covariates_joint_model_noXY_DATA_Yuen_2017_cases_ANNO_RR_estimate_account_for_functional_anno.html).

+ coding RR estimation accouting for div score, using the 7-mer ERV mutation rate mode, using all mutations of coding, promoters, promoter-proximal noncoding regions and UTRs to to adjust mutation rates. # 2. Further refining mutation rates
## 2.1 Investigation of ERVs derived mutation rates
>Extremely rare variantsreveal patterns of germline mutation rate heterogeneity in humans

+ This paper uses 35 million extremely rare variants to estimate base-level mutation rates upon a 7-mer model with other genomic and epigenomic features.
+ The data can be downloaded [here](http://mutation.sph.umich.edu/), corresponding [GitHub](https://github.com/carjed/mr-eel)

## 2.1 compare pair likelihood using the 3-mer mutation rate model and the 7-mer mutation rate model
> Leave out one chromosome during training and calculate the likelihood on the left-out chromosome.

+ Data analysis for WES data, using nonTADA genes to adjust for the effects of `div_score` and `GC_content`[here](./analysis/180321_compare_mutation_rate_models.html).

+ Data analysis for WES data, using nonfunctional synonymous mutatoins to adjust for the effects of `div_score` and `GC_content`[here](./analysis/180417_compare_mutation_rate_models.html).

+ Data analysis for WES data, using nonfunctional synonymous mutatoins, and addtional covaraites from the ERV model to adjust for the effects of `div_score` and `GC_content`, `RepT`, , `RecomboRate`, and several other epigenomic annotations[here](./analysis/180418_compare_mutation_rate_models_with_additional_covariates.html).

+ Data analysis for simulated data, data is simulated with the 7-mer ERV model, and fitted with both ERV model and the 3-mer Samocha model separately. Prediction is evaluated at the window level.
